entry.title: Comment 1
entry.content:
I am getting this error msg, any suggestions?

"The most recent Tor proxy test failed to use Tor."

entry.title: Comment 2
entry.content:
I would like say thank you for your really great work!

Unfortunately I'm struggled over following little problems:
1) If one uses bridges (as myself) and uninstall tor, all bridges are gone too!
2) If one thinks to copy and paste bridges into torrc by any editor. After that tor isn't able to read torrc correctly anymore and tor remain unable to run, at least for me under WinXP SP3.
3) If bridges are needed after new a installation, bridges can only be added one-by-one over tor's settings menu by add bridges.

Regards

entry.title: Comment 3
entry.content:
1) Yes, an uninstallation of tor will wipe everything related to tor. This includes anything customized in tor configurations.

2) use wordpad. notepad strips the soft returns from the file, turning it into one big line of text.

3) or you can click the "get bridges" button and get 3 at once.

entry.title: Comment 10
entry.content:
Connection based denial of service attack on Tor?
If I open both my router and directory ports on Tor, the number of open connections on Tor router port will rise until it hits the NAT connection limit on my small router. I upped the max connections from 4k to 7k and it just hit that limit too. Bizarrely, if I turn off directory services it doesn't do this (weird because the massive number of connections are NOT on the directory port). Also I notice that many relays have closed directory ports at tor status sites, is this the reason?

entry.title: Comment 11
entry.content:
Connection based denial of service attack on Tor?
If I open both my router and directory ports on Tor, the number of open connections on Tor router port will rise until it hits the NAT connection limit on my small router. I upped the max connections from 4k to 7k and it just hit that limit too. Bizarrely, if I turn off directory services it doesn't do this (the connections are NOT to the directory port). Also I notice that many relays have closed directory ports at tor status sites, is this the reason?

entry.title: Comment 12
entry.content:
Re:Connection based denial of service attack on Tor?
Nevermind, found great answer here:
http://archives.seul.org/tor/relays/Apr-2010/msg00078.html
